intro: Agapetes dispar, commonly known as the variable silverleaf. It is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family, native to the Andes mountains in South America. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves that are often covered in a silvery or whitish pubescence. It typically grows in cool, moist habitats such as cloud forests and high-altitude regions. Agapetes dispar produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale pink, blooming in late spring to early summer.
